H.content: we are always in some way late; “the consciousness only anticipates, ever, one delay too many”
H.linkedContent: we are always in some way late; “the consciousness only anticipates, ever, one delay too many”

OOG.content: sedimentary retention [as habitus, occurs because living consciousness is finite] is general form of protention conceived as unique, universal form of Living Present
OOG.linkedContent: sedimentary retention [as habitus, occurs because living consciousness is finite] is general form of protention conceived as unique, universal form of Living Present

OOG.content: for phenomenology, senses of sense is determined as object, available for regard or gaze, final category of everything can appear, that can be for pure consciousness
OOG.linkedContent: for phenomenology, senses of sense is determined as object, available for regard or gaze, final category of everything can appear, that can be for pure consciousness

OOG.content: objects join all regions to consciousness, the Ur-region
OOG.linkedContent: objects join all regions to consciousness, the Ur-region

OOG.content: for Husserl, the nondialectical, the Living Present, universal form of all consciousness
OOG.linkedContent: for Husserl, the nondialectical, the Living Present, universal form of all consciousness

HASD.content: [blurring lines btwn conscious/unconscious, man/animal] if animals can’t keep secrets, because they can’t represent as such, secret linked to Vorstellung, linked to lying, not presenting in speech that which one has an articulated representation, keep to oneself
HASD.linkedContent: [blurring lines btwn conscious/unconscious, man/animal] if animals can’t keep secrets, because they can’t represent as such, secret linked to Vorstellung, linked to lying, not presenting in speech that which one has an articulated representation, keep to oneself

VP.content: last court of appeal for phenomenology is “consciousness,” possibility of the self-presence of the present in the living present
VP.linkedContent: last court of appeal for phenomenology is “consciousness,” possibility of the self-presence of the present in the living present

VP.content: in phenomenology, transcendental consciousness, the archi-region, is absolutely singular, transcendental “I” distinguished from human, empirical, natural “I”
VP.linkedContent: in phenomenology, transcendental consciousness, the archi-region, is absolutely singular, transcendental “I” distinguished from human, empirical, natural “I”

VP.content: philosophical privilege of present-now, evidentness, conscious thought itself
VP.linkedContent: philosophical privilege of present-now, evidentness, conscious thought itself

VP.content: via Husserl, Greek metaphysics of presence becomes “modern” metaphysics of presence as self-consciousness, metaphysics of idea as representation (Vorstellung)
VP.linkedContent: via Husserl, Greek metaphysics of presence becomes “modern” metaphysics of presence as self-consciousness, metaphysics of idea as representation (Vorstellung)

VP.content: to enucleate consciousness from elsewhere than presence: eliminate all security and foundation
VP.linkedContent: to enucleate consciousness from elsewhere than presence: eliminate all security and foundation

FSW.content: acc. Heidegger, Hegel and Descartes conceive self-presence w/in opposition of consciousness to unconsciousness
FSW.linkedContent: acc. Heidegger, Hegel and Descartes conceive self-presence w/in opposition of consciousness to unconsciousness

FSW.content: for Freud, consciousness—surface exposed to external world
FSW.linkedContent: for Freud, consciousness—surface exposed to external world

TC.content: Artaud rejects psychoanalytic theater for its secret interiority > theater of cruelty a theater of dreams, of calculated dreams, cruelty as consciousness, exposed lucidity
TC.linkedContent: Artaud rejects psychoanalytic theater for its secret interiority > theater of cruelty a theater of dreams, of calculated dreams, cruelty as consciousness, exposed lucidity

TC.content: Artaud: consciousness gives to every act of life it’s blood-red color, its cruel nuance, life is always someone else’s death
TC.linkedContent: Artaud: consciousness gives to every act of life it’s blood-red color, its cruel nuance, life is always someone else’s death

POS.content: voice is consciousness itself when phonē is signifying substance > signifier and signified unite, signifier erases itself, exteriority of signifier reduced by spontaneous proximity
POS.linkedContent: voice is consciousness itself when phonē is signifying substance > signifier and signified unite, signifier erases itself, exteriority of signifier reduced by spontaneous proximity

OS.content: [via Heidegger] Beings are what is (must not be affected by time): privilege of 3rd person indicative (is, estin), as present participle becomes noun > same for consciousness
OS.linkedContent: [via Heidegger] Beings are what is (must not be affected by time): privilege of 3rd person indicative (is, estin), as present participle becomes noun > same for consciousness

ROP.content: royal weaver (le tisserand royal) of Platonic dialectic (then Aristotle, Hegel, Kant), belongs to order of ideational consciousness, cannot intervene to remove resistance of any sort
ROP.linkedContent: royal weaver (le tisserand royal) of Platonic dialectic (then Aristotle, Hegel, Kant), belongs to order of ideational consciousness, cannot intervene to remove resistance of any sort

FS.content: structural consciousness a catastrophic one, simultaneously destroyed & destructive (destructuring) > decadence, period proper to all movement of consciousness [Nietzsche]
FS.linkedContent: structural consciousness a catastrophic one, simultaneously destroyed & destructive (destructuring) > decadence, period proper to all movement of consciousness [Nietzsche]

FS.content: consciousness takes on meaning by way of consciousness of nothing, thus is speech brought forth > car la pensée de la chose comme ce qu'elle est se confond déjà avec l'expérience de la pure parole; et celle-ci avec l'expérience elle-même
FS.linkedContent: consciousness takes on meaning by way of consciousness of nothing, thus is speech brought forth > car la pensée de la chose comme ce qu'elle est se confond déjà avec l'expérience de la pure parole; et celle-ci avec l'expérience elle-même

DIF.content: consciousness, self-presence—subject cannot be thought w/out reference to presence as hupokeimenon or ousia > subject of consciousness has always manifested itself as self-presence
DIF.linkedContent: consciousness, self-presence—subject cannot be thought w/out reference to presence as hupokeimenon or ousia > subject of consciousness has always manifested itself as self-presence

O.content: Hegel: proof of science/logic solely in necessity of emergency (Hervorbringung), a räsonierende (ratiocinative, discursive) manner produces historical knowledge
O.linkedContent: Hegel: proof of science/logic solely in necessity of emergency (Hervorbringung), a räsonierende (ratiocinative, discursive) manner produces historical knowledge

OG.content: nonprohibition of proper name, consciousness, when name is called proper > attempt to restitute the irremediable impropriety of proper names
OG.linkedContent: nonprohibition of proper name, consciousness, when name is called proper > attempt to restitute the irremediable impropriety of proper names

OG.content: immediacy as myth of consciousness, self-presence, suppression of differance [a signifier that never falls into world/space]
OG.linkedContent: immediacy as myth of consciousness, self-presence, suppression of differance [a signifier that never falls into world/space]

SPEC.content: neither permanent traces nor resistance in [Freud’s] Perception-Consciousness (free circulation of energy w/out obstacle or binding), permanent trace supposes frayage (Bahnung) and an overcome resistance
SPEC.linkedContent: neither permanent traces nor resistance in [Freud’s] Perception-Consciousness (free circulation of energy w/out obstacle or binding), permanent trace supposes frayage (Bahnung) and an overcome resistance
